    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GUI()
      This method generates the anti-spam filter GUI for testing purposes

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int calculateFalseNegatives(javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel model)
      By being provided a DefaultTableModel, this function goes over the last and returns the number of false negatives as a consequence of the latest rules-weight configuration
      int calculateFalsePositives(javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel model)
      By being provided a DefaultTableModel, this function goes over the last and returns the number of false positives as a consequence of the latest rules-weight configuration
      javax.swing.JTextField getTextPathHam()
      This function returns the swing element JTextField containing the path for the ham messages file.

      This function returns the swing element JTextField containing the path for the Rules file.
      javax.swing.JTextField getTextPathSpam()
      This function returns the swing element JTextField containing the path for the spam messages file.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This function calls the GUI constructor and puts it on the screen
      void readRulesFile()
      This functions reads the goes over the rules files, getting all the names of the last in order to populate the populate the naming section, on both the automatic and manual configuration sections.
      void readRulesFileAuto()
      This function extrapolates over the automatic configuration generated files, in order to pick and implement best weights game of the anti-spam filter.
      void saveConfiguration(java.lang.String path, javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel model)
      This function pulls the data out of a given model and writes it on a given path, in order to allow future use

    • Method Detail

      • getTextPathRules

        public javax.swing.JTextField getTextPathRules()
        This function returns the swing element JTextField containing the path for the Rules file. By default it point to a file stored locally on the project folder
        Returns:

      • getTextPathHam

        public javax.swing.JTextField getTextPathHam()
        This function returns the swing element JTextField containing the path for the ham messages file. By default it point to a file stored locally on the project folder
        Returns:

      • getTextPathSpam

        public javax.swing.JTextField getTextPathSpam()
        This function returns the swing element JTextField containing the path for the spam messages file. By default it point to a file stored locally on the project folder
        Returns:

      • readRulesFile

        public void readRulesFile()
        This functions reads the goes over the rules files, getting all the names of the last in order to populate the populate the naming section, on both the automatic and manual configuration sections. Moreover this function also gets the weights associated with each rule if available

      • readRulesFileAuto

        public void readRulesFileAuto()
        This function extrapolates over the automatic configuration generated files, in order to pick and implement best weights game of the anti-spam filter. The latest affects exclusively the automatic configuration section of the GUI

      • calculateFalsePositives

        public int calculateFalsePositives(javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel model)
        By being provided a DefaultTableModel, this function goes over the last and returns the number of false positives as a consequence of the latest rules-weight configuration

        Returns:
